MONL.content: identify in order to combat: impulses, phantasms, “ideologies” “fetishizations,” and symbolics of appropriation
MONL.linkedContent: identify in order to combat: impulses, phantasms, “ideologies” “fetishizations,” and symbolics of appropriation

FK.content: machine-like & faith as one and the same possibility, machine-like & sacrosanctity (heilig, holy, safe, unscathed, free, “swollen”) of the phallic effect: phallus as phainesthai, phenomenon (day of phallus) & also phantasm, fetish, specter, its double: colossal automaticity [phallic in bold 2x]
FK.linkedContent: machine-like & faith as one and the same possibility, machine-like & sacrosanctity (heilig, holy, safe, unscathed, free, “swollen”) of the phallic effect: phallus as phainesthai, phenomenon (day of phallus) & also phantasm, fetish, specter, its double: colossal automaticity [phallic in bold 2x]

FK.content: phallus, the marionette, virtuality of virtuality, distinct from penis: parade fetish, the healthy, the automatic sur-viving, faith in most living as dead
FK.linkedContent: phallus, the marionette, virtuality of virtuality, distinct from penis: parade fetish, the healthy, the automatic sur-viving, faith in most living as dead

FK.content: matrix of unlimited, general fetishization of Thing itself > read the unscathed as spontaneity of erection or pregnancy
FK.linkedContent: matrix of unlimited, general fetishization of Thing itself > read the unscathed as spontaneity of erection or pregnancy

FK.content: Kant’s dignity (Würdigkeit) of the end itself (of finite being), absolute value beyond market price > transcendence, spectrality, fetishism: religiosity of religion
FK.linkedContent: Kant’s dignity (Würdigkeit) of the end itself (of finite being), absolute value beyond market price > transcendence, spectrality, fetishism: religiosity of religion

LOBL.content: no paradigmatic text, only cryptic haunting from mark to mark, no piece, no metonymy, no integral corpus, thus no fetishism
LOBL.linkedContent: no paradigmatic text, only cryptic haunting from mark to mark, no piece, no metonymy, no integral corpus, thus no fetishism

LOBL.content: double invagination, through labor of translation, can be brought to bear on gaine in Glas [cf. GLAS p. 210 “against” Hegel, Marx, and Freud on subject of fetishism]
LOBL.linkedContent: double invagination, through labor of translation, can be brought to bear on gaine in Glas [cf. GLAS p. 210 “against” Hegel, Marx, and Freud on subject of fetishism]

LOBL.content: surplus-value and process of fetishization: the wearing away, the using, of what is out of use, “under-glass” quality of text in translation
LOBL.linkedContent: surplus-value and process of fetishization: the wearing away, the using, of what is out of use, “under-glass” quality of text in translation

LOBL.content: hymen is an “immediately” that weds symbiosis to synthanatosis (in a triumph w/out identity) [is the hymen not a fetish? embalm? encrypt? the at once of disavowal? cf. GLAS p. 210]
LOBL.linkedContent: hymen is an “immediately” that weds symbiosis to synthanatosis (in a triumph w/out identity) [is the hymen not a fetish? embalm? encrypt? the at once of disavowal? cf. GLAS p. 210]

MC.content: [artist as pervert?] art (particularly literature) can isolate performatively its own context for its own event > the “oeuvre”
MC.linkedContent: [artist as pervert?] art (particularly literature) can isolate performatively its own context for its own event > the “oeuvre”

MC.content: this large, stereotomic margin of play is perhaps largest of all (during certain history) but not infinite [?] [see also Christianity/Capitalism not infinite]
MC.linkedContent: this large, stereotomic margin of play is perhaps largest of all (during certain history) but not infinite [?] [see also Christianity/Capitalism not infinite]

SPOM.content: theologizing fetishization of money linked to ideology to religion (to idol or fetish)
SPOM.linkedContent: theologizing fetishization of money linked to ideology to religion (to idol or fetish)

SPOM.content: Marx’s theory of ideology: the “second” ghost > incorporation of autonomized spirit [“first” ghost?], ideological (fetish) lent a borrowed body [see DEBT], second incarnation “conferred on an initial idealization,” a non-natural body, a technical body or an institutional body (helmet of ideologem or fetish under armor)
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx’s theory of ideology: the “second” ghost > incorporation of autonomized spirit [“first” ghost?], ideological (fetish) lent a borrowed body [see DEBT], second incarnation “conferred on an initial idealization,” a non-natural body, a technical body or an institutional body (helmet of ideologem or fetish under armor)

SPOM.content: that’s not all: specificity of process can still capitalize spectralization > the first ghost effect (autonomized spirit) can be incorporated, negated, integrated as one’s own human body
SPOM.linkedContent: that’s not all: specificity of process can still capitalize spectralization > the first ghost effect (autonomized spirit) can be incorporated, negated, integrated as one’s own human body

SPOM.content: for Marx, this turns one into absolute ghost, ghost of ghost > delirious, hallucinogenic moment of Stirner’s hubris
SPOM.linkedContent: for Marx, this turns one into absolute ghost, ghost of ghost > delirious, hallucinogenic moment of Stirner’s hubris

SPOM.content: the secret (Geheimnis) of the fetishism of the commodity, the “germ” of the money-form, une table tournante, example of an apparition
SPOM.linkedContent: the secret (Geheimnis) of the fetishism of the commodity, the “germ” of the money-form, une table tournante, example of an apparition

SPOM.content: as soon as there’s production there’s fetishism (idealization, autonomization, dematerialization, spectral incorporation, mourning work thus work)
SPOM.linkedContent: as soon as there’s production there’s fetishism (idealization, autonomization, dematerialization, spectral incorporation, mourning work thus work)

SPOM.content: for Marx, all this co-extensive w/ commodity production; in our view, this is his gesture of exorcism
SPOM.linkedContent: for Marx, all this co-extensive w/ commodity production; in our view, this is his gesture of exorcism

SPOM.content: for Marx, there’s a phantomatic objectivity before commodity value [?] product of labor petrifies, erects, hardens (feminine character of commodity-chimera?)
SPOM.linkedContent: for Marx, there’s a phantomatic objectivity before commodity value [?] product of labor petrifies, erects, hardens (feminine character of commodity-chimera?)

MPM.content: de Man’s texts on promise pervert tranquil assurance of what we call “performative” > too much of promise is irremediable disturbance/perversion, is also a trap, also renders promise possible (indestructible), and comical
MPM.linkedContent: de Man’s texts on promise pervert tranquil assurance of what we call “performative” > too much of promise is irremediable disturbance/perversion, is also a trap, also renders promise possible (indestructible), and comical

F.content: cryptonomic translation makes taboo word a rebus, functions as undecipherable fetish
F.linkedContent: cryptonomic translation makes taboo word a rebus, functions as undecipherable fetish

F.content: Ichspaltung rethought when it is not Fetish vs. Thing (in-itself) but Fetish-Thing as cipher to be translated interminably
F.linkedContent: Ichspaltung rethought when it is not Fetish vs. Thing (in-itself) but Fetish-Thing as cipher to be translated interminably

WM.content: inscription on coinage, scene of exchange btwn economic and linguistic > the 2 types of signifier supplement each other in problematic of fetishism in Nietzsche & Marx
WM.linkedContent: inscription on coinage, scene of exchange btwn economic and linguistic > the 2 types of signifier supplement each other in problematic of fetishism in Nietzsche & Marx

POS.content: paraphrasing Freud, speaking of present/absent penis (the same thing), we must recognize truth as “normal prototype of the fetish”
POS.linkedContent: paraphrasing Freud, speaking of present/absent penis (the same thing), we must recognize truth as “normal prototype of the fetish”

SP.content: the feminine, that which cannot be pinned down by truth > this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, female sexuality, nor an essentializing fetish [for those inexperienced brobags (philosophers, artists) who believe they can capture]
SP.linkedContent: the feminine, that which cannot be pinned down by truth > this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, female sexuality, nor an essentializing fetish [for those inexperienced brobags (philosophers, artists) who believe they can capture]

SP.content: re: veil, to delimit, undo, come undone, would this not return again to unveiling? the destruction of the fetish? as much as it is a question, this question is interminable
SP.linkedContent: re: veil, to delimit, undo, come undone, would this not return again to unveiling? the destruction of the fetish? as much as it is a question, this question is interminable

SW.content: [BEAUTIFUL PASSAGE, as if they all aren’t] could a “theory of fetishism” ever measure up to infinite tenderness of “my own tallith” (as if such phrase preceded ipseity, “I”)? stranger to all maudlin, effusion, pathos—to all “Passion” > yet, compassion w/out limit: absolute delay of verdict that is/was/will make itself arrive w/out luminous vision (glory) > belongs to the night, my white tallith, absolute night
SW.linkedContent: [BEAUTIFUL PASSAGE, as if they all aren’t] could a “theory of fetishism” ever measure up to infinite tenderness of “my own tallith” (as if such phrase preceded ipseity, “I”)? stranger to all maudlin, effusion, pathos—to all “Passion” > yet, compassion w/out limit: absolute delay of verdict that is/was/will make itself arrive w/out luminous vision (glory) > belongs to the night, my white tallith, absolute night

SW.content: tallith not incommensurable w/ fetish, but a generalized not restricted fetishism (Glas); theory of fetish no longer merely a theory at moment of verdict
SW.linkedContent: tallith not incommensurable w/ fetish, but a generalized not restricted fetishism (Glas); theory of fetish no longer merely a theory at moment of verdict

REST.content: question of fetishism extended beyond its “political economy,” its “psychoanalysis,” even beyond simple, traditional opposition btwn fetish & thing itself
REST.linkedContent: question of fetishism extended beyond its “political economy,” its “psychoanalysis,” even beyond simple, traditional opposition btwn fetish & thing itself

REST.content: for Freud, the shoe always a “form” of prosthesis, but always as a penis (woman’s penis too)? but Ferenczi recognizes in it the vagina
REST.linkedContent: for Freud, the shoe always a “form” of prosthesis, but always as a penis (woman’s penis too)? but Ferenczi recognizes in it the vagina

REST.content: Derrida’s reading of Freud’s shoe fetish: shoe replaces that which is lacking not because of its form but because of its directional situation > syntax of a movement upwards
REST.linkedContent: Derrida’s reading of Freud’s shoe fetish: shoe replaces that which is lacking not because of its form but because of its directional situation > syntax of a movement upwards

REST.content: Freud does not designate the fetish as a detachable whole: a relatively detachable part of an always divisible ensemble
REST.linkedContent: Freud does not designate the fetish as a detachable whole: a relatively detachable part of an always divisible ensemble

REST.content: for Freud, certain symbols cannot be masculine & feminine at same time, but bisexual symbolization remains archaic, irrepressible tendency going back to child ignorant of sexual difference
REST.linkedContent: for Freud, certain symbols cannot be masculine & feminine at same time, but bisexual symbolization remains archaic, irrepressible tendency going back to child ignorant of sexual difference

REST.content: as in fetishism trial, everything is a business & economy of detail, of la détaille (de-tailing/unsizing), you can’t do w/out detail
REST.linkedContent: as in fetishism trial, everything is a business & economy of detail, of la détaille (de-tailing/unsizing), you can’t do w/out detail

REST.content: Heidegger & Shapiro bound themselves together to law of normal usage, the pair, ligatured worrying dismemberment in order to limit it: pair inhibits “fetishizing” movement, represses diabolical (i.e. a double, duplicity, w/out a pair)—pair rivets (rive) things to “normal” use
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger & Shapiro bound themselves together to law of normal usage, the pair, ligatured worrying dismemberment in order to limit it: pair inhibits “fetishizing” movement, represses diabolical (i.e. a double, duplicity, w/out a pair)—pair rivets (rive) things to “normal” use

REST.content: what looks like a process of fetishization in Heidegger (uselessness of product at work in work) is, to Heidegger, a strange process of alētheia
REST.linkedContent: what looks like a process of fetishization in Heidegger (uselessness of product at work in work) is, to Heidegger, a strange process of alētheia

REST.content: compare two shoes (not a pair) to gaine in Glas, sheath (garment) > bisexuality of the double in 2 shoes > displace sexual decidability, philosophico-psychoanlatyical opposition btwn fetish & thing (castration as truth of truth)
REST.linkedContent: compare two shoes (not a pair) to gaine in Glas, sheath (garment) > bisexuality of the double in 2 shoes > displace sexual decidability, philosophico-psychoanlatyical opposition btwn fetish & thing (castration as truth of truth)

REST.content: shoes sheath (gainent), to what profit, what sex? an undone stricture of laces, the girdle too, perhaps allows (donnerait) to be seen [Derrida quotes Balzac describing a naked, living, female foot protruding from a canvas—visitors médusés]
REST.linkedContent: shoes sheath (gainent), to what profit, what sex? an undone stricture of laces, the girdle too, perhaps allows (donnerait) to be seen [Derrida quotes Balzac describing a naked, living, female foot protruding from a canvas—visitors médusés]

REST.content: what’s essential for Heidegger is making the overflowing appear by “earth,” “shoes,” “world” > il faudrait les ressaisir à l’instant où le hors-d’usage détaché (relativement déstricturé) donne lieu, a sort of abyssal surplus value, une surenchère sans fond > we can speak of conditions of fetishization of product/work, surplus value forms a truth-effect, useless gives way to speculative exploitation, more than useful (plus qu’utile): useful for grasping usefulness of useful [cf. pp. 339-41 double/triple uselessness (work, product, useless for grasping usefulness)]
REST.linkedContent: what’s essential for Heidegger is making the overflowing appear by “earth,” “shoes,” “world” > il faudrait les ressaisir à l’instant où le hors-d’usage détaché (relativement déstricturé) donne lieu, a sort of abyssal surplus value, une surenchère sans fond > we can speak of conditions of fetishization of product/work, surplus value forms a truth-effect, useless gives way to speculative exploitation, more than useful (plus qu’utile): useful for grasping usefulness of useful [cf. pp. 339-41 double/triple uselessness (work, product, useless for grasping usefulness)]

REST.content: when the detached calls for reattachment: a discourse is sketched, maneuver to call for adherence
REST.linkedContent: when the detached calls for reattachment: a discourse is sketched, maneuver to call for adherence

REST.content: annexing narcissism to fetishism, we’d never be finished, 4 forms of rendering: 1) render oneself in painting 2) render something to oneself, se payer 3) to go somewhere (se rendre quelque part) 4) given in to someone (se rendre à quelqu’un), surrender
REST.linkedContent: annexing narcissism to fetishism, we’d never be finished, 4 forms of rendering: 1) render oneself in painting 2) render something to oneself, se payer 3) to go somewhere (se rendre quelque part) 4) given in to someone (se rendre à quelqu’un), surrender

TR.content: if theft is to be a sin, it must be done for the crime itself, not for use value (to eat) but for exchange, fetish value (certain uselessness)
TR.linkedContent: if theft is to be a sin, it must be done for the crime itself, not for use value (to eat) but for exchange, fetish value (certain uselessness)

EL.content: the turn to everyday sacredness (secular Hebrew): miraculous manna but also profanatory jouissance > sorcerers: sinister masquerade, quasi Esperanto or Valapük, living dead in a shoddy resurrection used for commerce > evacuation & perversion of meaning
EL.linkedContent: the turn to everyday sacredness (secular Hebrew): miraculous manna but also profanatory jouissance > sorcerers: sinister masquerade, quasi Esperanto or Valapük, living dead in a shoddy resurrection used for commerce > evacuation & perversion of meaning

EL.content: the false cadaver will avenge itself its carnival disguises, its cadaverous instrumentality
EL.linkedContent: the false cadaver will avenge itself its carnival disguises, its cadaverous instrumentality

EL.content: for Scholem, for language to avenge itself against secularization: 1) it must be someone, bear the name of someone, remain attached to its creator 2) no iterability at source: technology is secondary or evil, can only befall (survenir) it [this exteriorizing of contamination is similar to Christian idealism, a spiritual interiorization separated from body, time, letter, carnal signifier]
EL.linkedContent: for Scholem, for language to avenge itself against secularization: 1) it must be someone, bear the name of someone, remain attached to its creator 2) no iterability at source: technology is secondary or evil, can only befall (survenir) it [this exteriorizing of contamination is similar to Christian idealism, a spiritual interiorization separated from body, time, letter, carnal signifier]

EL.content: iconoclasm & idolatry at same time (if that’s possible): turn infinite value into a commercial one (both use & exchange)
EL.linkedContent: iconoclasm & idolatry at same time (if that’s possible): turn infinite value into a commercial one (both use & exchange)

EL.content: w/in “logic” of fetishism, no one ones who’s doing the fetishizing: Scholem or those he accuses? (via Enlightenment tradition prepared by Spinoza, it would be Scholem)
EL.linkedContent: w/in “logic” of fetishism, no one ones who’s doing the fetishizing: Scholem or those he accuses? (via Enlightenment tradition prepared by Spinoza, it would be Scholem)

HST.content: grave substitution (one worthy of name), life for another, or life for something (contaminate logic of who w/ what, ethics w/ arithmetic, arithméthique) > (fetishism is only a figure of this)
HST.linkedContent: grave substitution (one worthy of name), life for another, or life for something (contaminate logic of who w/ what, ethics w/ arithmetic, arithméthique) > (fetishism is only a figure of this)

+R.content: simulacra of fetishes (fetishism generalized) because classical logics of fetishism opposes fetishized bit (mors) to thing itself (God, original referent, transcendental phallus)
+R.linkedContent: simulacra of fetishes (fetishism generalized) because classical logics of fetishism opposes fetishized bit (mors) to thing itself (God, original referent, transcendental phallus)

TN.content: origin of fetishism [?], desire to touch what touches Jesus’ body (garments), touching w/out touching > made safe, immune, by faith of what touch signifies (not by touch itself)
TN.linkedContent: origin of fetishism [?], desire to touch what touches Jesus’ body (garments), touching w/out touching > made safe, immune, by faith of what touch signifies (not by touch itself)

BSi.content: to think the marionette, difference btwn marionettes, not the living of life but a living w/out being—simulacrum of being, prosthesis, substitute for the being of the thing itself—fetish—life death at same time > marionette [Marion’s Dieu sans l’Être]
BSi.linkedContent: to think the marionette, difference btwn marionettes, not the living of life but a living w/out being—simulacrum of being, prosthesis, substitute for the being of the thing itself—fetish—life death at same time > marionette [Marion’s Dieu sans l’Être]

OG.content: [re: certain interpretation of Rousseau] Derrida wonders if the singularity of each substitution [for Rousseau’s mother] loses significance, each cleavage blurred, when a totalitarian psychoanalysis of existentialist or phenomenological nature claims diffuse, total, sexuality
OG.linkedContent: [re: certain interpretation of Rousseau] Derrida wonders if the singularity of each substitution [for Rousseau’s mother] loses significance, each cleavage blurred, when a totalitarian psychoanalysis of existentialist or phenomenological nature claims diffuse, total, sexuality

OG.content: dangerous supplement inconceivable to reason: no longer diverting total enjoyment toward a substitute, but experiencing it or miming it directly and in its totality [not kissing the bed to get close to Mamma, but conjuring the presence of Mamma]
OG.linkedContent: dangerous supplement inconceivable to reason: no longer diverting total enjoyment toward a substitute, but experiencing it or miming it directly and in its totality [not kissing the bed to get close to Mamma, but conjuring the presence of Mamma]

OG.content: for Rousseau, child can’t relate to separated signifier, child will spontaneously donner la change, doesn’t treat l’argent pour l’argent > no relation to sign for itself, no fetish
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, child can’t relate to separated signifier, child will spontaneously donner la change, doesn’t treat l’argent pour l’argent > no relation to sign for itself, no fetish

OG.content: perverse use of signifier permitted & tolerated by imitation
OG.linkedContent: perverse use of signifier permitted & tolerated by imitation

EU.content: Glas: generalized fetishism, pull of the discourse of castration toward affirmative dissemination [also continues pursuing project of grammatology, etc.]
EU.linkedContent: Glas: generalized fetishism, pull of the discourse of castration toward affirmative dissemination [also continues pursuing project of grammatology, etc.]

SPEC.content: [Ernst’s fort/da] collective unity [of toys] is apparatus of game that can dislocate itself > word for things in this theory of set is Zeug, which is also penis: supplementary complex that can reassemble parents
SPEC.linkedContent: [Ernst’s fort/da] collective unity [of toys] is apparatus of game that can dislocate itself > word for things in this theory of set is Zeug, which is also penis: supplementary complex that can reassemble parents

FV.content: circular itinerary [re: Lacan’s Poe], Dupin & analyst find letter where they expect it: Queen wants letter-fetish brought back to her, exchanges one fetish for another w/out spending—because there’s equivalence here (assurance of return): circle of restricted economy, stricture of the ring
FV.linkedContent: circular itinerary [re: Lacan’s Poe], Dupin & analyst find letter where they expect it: Queen wants letter-fetish brought back to her, exchanges one fetish for another w/out spending—because there’s equivalence here (assurance of return): circle of restricted economy, stricture of the ring

FV.content: castration-truth is that which contracts itself (stricture of the ring): brings signifier, fetish, phallus, letter back into their oikos, familiar dwelling, proper place
FV.linkedContent: castration-truth is that which contracts itself (stricture of the ring): brings signifier, fetish, phallus, letter back into their oikos, familiar dwelling, proper place

FV.content: the lack never lacks a place: indivisible circulation of proper
FV.linkedContent: the lack never lacks a place: indivisible circulation of proper

FV.content: lack does not have its place in dissemination
FV.linkedContent: lack does not have its place in dissemination

FV.content: for Lacan, Femininity is the Truth (of) castration, best figure of castration, because in logic of signifier it (elle) has always already been castrated > Femininity “leaves” something in circulation (here the letter), detaches something she never had, brought back to itself
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, Femininity is the Truth (of) castration, best figure of castration, because in logic of signifier it (elle) has always already been castrated > Femininity “leaves” something in circulation (here the letter), detaches something she never had, brought back to itself

FV.content: this 1st castration (pre-castration) affects w/ castration/femininity whoever holds the letter
FV.linkedContent: this 1st castration (pre-castration) affects w/ castration/femininity whoever holds the letter

CHOR.content: “essentializing fetishes” (truth, femininity, essentiality of woman or feminine sexuality as fetishes)—but one must be precise about fetishism [i.e. general fetishism in Glas], and its context, if only to displace it
CHOR.linkedContent: “essentializing fetishes” (truth, femininity, essentiality of woman or feminine sexuality as fetishes)—but one must be precise about fetishism [i.e. general fetishism in Glas], and its context, if only to displace it
